intro: Ardisia luzonensis, commonly known as Luzon starwood, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, glossy leaves. The plant produces clusters of white to pinkish flowers that are followed by bright red berries. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
